B1sBHcItb.description: Non-adjusted acceleration along Z axis in range [-3, 3]
B1sBHcItb.label: Z

BkdA4cUFW.description: Board port to which the X axis output is connected. Should be capable of analog reading analog values.
BkdA4cUFW.label: Px

BynRV5UKb.description: Board port to which the Z axis output is connected. Should be capable of analog reading analog values.
BynRV5UKb.label: Pz

H1EVB58Y-.description: Non-adjusted acceleration along X axis in range [-3, 3]
H1EVB58Y-.label: X

S1DHH5LFb.description: Non-adjusted acceleration along Y axis in range [-3, 3]
S1DHH5LFb.label: Y

rk9RE5ItW.description: Board port to which the Y axis output is connected. Should be capable of analog reading analog values.
rk9RE5ItW.label: Py

@/adxl335-accelerometer.description:
Reads acceleration from an ADXL335 based sensor. Note that concrete ADXL335 instances differ from each other and their output should be adjusted for precise mesearument.

By default the values are coarse although reasonable enough to determine shaking and approximate orientation.

For an ideally factored accelerometer the outputs are in range ±3ɡ.

Possible errors:
— Invalid port

@/adxl335-convert.description: Utility node. Converts raw ADC value of an ADXL335 accelerometer to approximate acceleration in ɡ (standard gravity) units.

BkoeN9Ay7.description: The latest read value in range 0.0 … 1.0
BkoeN9Ay7.label: VAL

r1l3XcR17.description: Analog port to read from. Should start with `A` to succeed.
r1l3XcR17.label: PORT

@/analog-sensor.description:
Reads analog signal value from analog sensor.

Possible errors:
— Invalid port

BkiFZfEUH.description: The board port to which the sensor is connected
BkiFZfEUH.label: PORT

SJj3WzELr.description: Pulses when a reading completes successfully
SJj3WzELr.label: OK

SkYc-fVLH.description: Trigger sensor update, that is starts a new reading
SkYc-fVLH.label: UPD

@/binary-sensor.description: Represents a sensor which carries its signal through a single pin and is either high or low. The switches are expected to be instant, without bouncing involved (e.g., a binary line sensor, capacitive touch sensor, pyroelectric infrared motion sensor).

BJ--G1tI-.description: Last read value. Equals to `true` while the button is pressed (hold down) and `false` while it is released.
BJ--G1tI-.label: PRS

ByNiWkt8Z.description: Board port number the button is connected to.
ByNiWkt8Z.label: PORT

@/button.description:
Reads a generic button or another mechanical switch. It is expected that the button is low while pressed, the on-board pull-up resistor is enabled if possible. The node provides signal debounce with 20 ms settle delay.

Possible errors:
— Invalid port

SkUQV5wIb.description: Board port number the thermometer is connected to.
SkUQV5wIb.label: PORT

@/dht11-thermometer.description:
Reads temperature and humidity from a DHT11 sensor. Also named RHT01.

Possible errors:
— Checksum failure
— Read timeout
— Initialization error
— Invalid port

r1EHReikf.description: Divide by 10 to calculate percents. Divide by 100 to convert to [0, 1] range

Hk8tJZokG.content: The MSB in D2 stores temperature sign

@/dht2x-pack.description: Utility. Packs raw data from a DHT21 or higher thermometer into meaningful humidity and temperature.

SJpVg-jJM.description: Triggers an update, i.e. reading values again.
SJpVg-jJM.label: UPD

rJ84xbjyG.description: Board port number the thermometer is connected to.
rJ84xbjyG.label: PORT

@/dht2x-thermometer.description:
Reads temperature and humidity from a DHT21 or compatible sensor: DHT21, DHT22, DHT33, DHT44, AM2301, HM2301, AM2302, AM2303, RHT02, RHT03, RHT04, RHT05.

Possible errors:
— Checksum failure
— Read timeout
— Initialization error
— Invalid port

HJMBihlj1G.description: Board port number the thermometer is connected to.
HJMBihlj1G.label: PORT

SyQSohgjJz.description: Triggers an update, i.e. reading values again.
SyQSohgjJz.label: UPD

@/dhtxx-read-raw.description:
Utility. Reads raw data bytes from a DHTxx thermometer with one-wire interface.

Possible errors:
— Checksum failure
— Read timeout
— Initialization error
— Invalid port

r1o7Hdlgf.description: Triggers a new reading, i.e. date/time values update
r1o7Hdlgf.label: UPD

@/ds1307-rtc-read.description:
Reads a date/time value from a DS1307, DS1337, DS1338, or DS3231real-time clock IC.

Possible errors:
— Invalid I2C address
— Data too long to fit in transmit buffer
— Received NACK on transmit of address
— Received NACK on transmit of data
— Other error
— No bytes written. Probably due to buffer overflow
— Can't read the time. Probably due to buffer underflow

B1h8InZgz.description: Trigger a new write of the date/time data provided
B1h8InZgz.label: UPD

SkH2Ih-ef.description: Pulses when the write is done
SkH2Ih-ef.label: DONE

r1SQLh-gf.description: Day value. Valid range depends on month and can be [1, 28-31].
r1SQLh-gf.label: DAY

@/ds1307-rtc-write.description:
Writes a new date/time value to a DS1307, DS1337, DS1338, or DS3231 real-time clock IC. Useful as a throw-away node to setup the RTC once after you install a backup battery.

Possible errors:
— Invalid I2C address
— Data too long to fit in transmit buffer
— Received NACK on transmit of address
— Received NACK on transmit of data
— Other error
— No bytes written. Probably due to buffer overflow.

B1VSPLfEG.description: Board port number the sensor is connected to.
B1VSPLfEG.label: PORT

BJkDP8GEM.description: The last read temperature value measured in °C.
BJkDP8GEM.label: Tc

SJlIvIMEM.description: Triggers new update, i.e. temperature reading.
SJlIvIMEM.label: UPD

rkZ3_IzEG.description: Pulses when a reading is done and `Tc` is refreshed.
rkZ3_IzEG.label: DONE

@/ds18b20-thermometer.description:
Reads temperature from a DS18B20 sensor. Expects single-drop bus setup, i.e. one thermometer on a port.

Possible errors:
— Invalid port
— Initialization sequence error

@/gp2y0a-linearize.description: Transforms raw analog values of a Sharp infrared range meter to distance units.

B1rqmq_8Z.description: Triggers an update, i.e. reading values again.
B1rqmq_8Z.label: UPD

ByaY75_Ib.description: Board port number the sensor is connected to.
ByaY75_Ib.label: PORT

H1JpXq_I-.description: Measured distance in meters. Trustworhy only for distances in [0.1, 0.8] meters range.
H1JpXq_I-.label: Dm

@/gp2y0a21-range-meter.description:
Reads Sharp infrared range meter GP2Y0A21YK0F (the one with 10…80 cm range).

Possible errors:
— Invalid port

H1ny9SPLW.description: Triggers an update, i.e. reading values again.
H1ny9SPLW.label: UPD

S10ecHDUW.description: Measured distance in meters. Trustworhy only for distances in [0.04, 0.30] meters range.
S10ecHDUW.label: Dm

SkDkcrvI-.description: Board port number the sensor is connected to.
SkDkcrvI-.label: PORT

@/gp2y0a41-range-meter.description:
Reads Sharp infrared range meter GP2Y0A41SK0F (the one with 4…30 cm range).

Possible errors:
— Invalid port

ByWU5i18H.description: Makes h-bridge reacts on incoming value change while `ACT` is true.
ByWU5i18H.label: ACT

HknX0fRU-.description: Board port to which the PWM (aka Enable) pin of the H-Bridge is connected. The port should be capable of producting PWM signal.
HknX0fRU-.label: PWM

S18NCzAIb.description: Board port to which the direction pin of the H-Bridge is connected.
S18NCzAIb.label: DIR

SJpVAGRUW.description: Desired speed of the motor in [-1.0, 1.0] range. Negative values denote clockwise rotation, zero denotes full stop, positive values denote counterclockwise direction.
SJpVAGRUW.label: SPD

@/h-bridge-dc-motor.description:
Drives a DC motor through H-Bridge IC such as L293 or L298.

Possible errors:
— Invalid port

H17aAZ08Z.description: Multiply by 340 m/s (speed of sound) and divide by 2 (roundtrip)

SJmoRbAUW.description: Triggers new ultrasonic ping which would result in the output update once sound echo will be captured. Pulses coming within 60 ms window after last one are ignored to fight sensor’s PCB resonance.
SJmoRbAUW.label: PING

r1xoR-C8-.description: Board port to which sensor’s `echo` pin is connected.
r1xoR-C8-.label: ECHO

rJa50WCL-.description: Board port to which sensor’s `trig` pin is connected.
rJa50WCL-.label: TRIG

@/hc-sr04-ultrasonic-range.description:
Measures distance with HC-SR04 ultrasonic range meter. Outputs infinity on no echo.

Possible errors:
— Invalid port
— Initialization error

Bk2zMWALZ.description: Board port to which sensor’s `trig` pin is connected.
Bk2zMWALZ.label: TRIG

Syn7fWCLZ.description: Last measured sound roundtrip time in seconds.
Syn7fWCLZ.label: Ts

r1EjbRvLB.description: Use nodes from the `xod-dev/hc-sr04` standard library instead.

rJ0fMWALb.description: Board port to which sensor’s `echo` pin is connected.
rJ0fMWALb.label: ECHO

rJPQfbCIW.description: Triggers new ultrasonic ping which would result in the output update once sound echo will be captured. Pulses coming within 60 ms window after last one are ignored to fight sensor’s PCB resonance.
rJPQfbCIW.label: PING

@/hc-sr04-ultrasonic-time.description:
Measures sound roundtrip time with HC-SR04 ultrasonic range meter. Outputs infinity on no echo.

Possible errors:
— Invalid port
— Wrong connection

H13sVewxm.description: Triggers initialization of the sensor and sets sensitivity
H13sVewxm.label: INIT

HkQfr17Kb.description: Pitch angular velocity. I.e. spin around X axis. Expressed in radians per second.
HkQfr17Kb.label: PTCH

S1uzHkQKW.description: Yaw angular velocity. I.e. spin around Z axis. Expressed in radians per second.
S1uzHkQKW.label: YAW

SJOWBJQKW.description: I²C address. 6Ah by default. Some board configurations use 6Bh instead.
SJOWBJQKW.label: ADDR

SkBfBymFW.description: Roll angular velocity. I.e. spin around Y axis. Expressed in radians per second.
SkBfBymFW.label: ROLL

rk5-Hy7tW.description: Sensitivity. Can be 250 (default), 500, or 2000. Defines bounds of measurements expressed in degrees per second. E.g. max ±500 degrees per second. The lower the sensitivity the better output precission. Inaccurate values are rounded up to a nearest correct sensitivity level.
rk5-Hy7tW.label: SEN

@/l3g4200-gyro.description:
Reads angular velocity from a gyroscope based on L3G4200 IC by STMicroelectronics. It is expected the gyro is connected to the first hardware I²C bus.

Possible errors:
— Invalid I2C address
— Data too long to fit in transmit buffer
— Received NACK on transmit of address
— Received NACK on transmit of data
— Other error
— No bytes written. Probably due to buffer overflow
— Can't read the value

BJlCuH8ojQ.description: Triggers an update, i.e. reading values again.
BJlCuH8ojQ.label: UPD

H1JpXq_I-.description: Measured distance in meters. Trustworthy only for distances in [0.3, 1.5] meters range. Returns wrong values if an object is too close to the sensor.
H1JpXq_I-.label: Dm

H1mAuB8sjm.description: Board port number the sensor is connected to.
H1mAuB8sjm.label: PORT

@/gp2y0a02-range-meter.description:
Reads Sharp infrared range meter GP2Y0A02YK0F (the one with 20…150 cm range).

Possible errors:
— Invalid port

HkQfr17Kb.description: Pitch angular velocity. I.e. spin around X axis. Expressed in radians per second.
HkQfr17Kb.label: PTCH

S1uzHkQKW.description: Yaw angular velocity. I.e. spin around Z axis. Expressed in radians per second.
S1uzHkQKW.label: YAW

SJOWBJQKW.description: I²C address. 0x6A by default. Some board configurations use 0x6B instead.
SJOWBJQKW.label: ADDR

SkBfBymFW.description: Roll angular velocity. I.e. spin around Y axis. Expressed in radians per second.
SkBfBymFW.label: ROLL

r1Kh4gDxm.description: Triggers initialization of the sensor and sets sensitivity
r1Kh4gDxm.label: INIT

rk5-Hy7tW.description: Sensitivity. Can be 250 (default), 500, or 2000. Defines bounds of measurements expressed in degrees per second. E.g. max ±500 degrees per second. The lower the sensitivity the better output precission. Inaccurate values are rounded up to a nearest correct sensitivity level.
rk5-Hy7tW.label: SEN

@/l3gd20h-gyro.description:
Reads angular velocity from a gyroscope based on L3GD20H IC by STMicroelectronics. It is expected the gyro is connected to the first hardware I²C bus.

Possible errors:
— Invalid I2C address
— Data too long to fit in transmit buffer
— Received NACK on transmit of address
— Received NACK on transmit of data
— Other error
— No bytes written. Probably due to buffer overflow
— Can't read the value

B1oqkTnIb.description: Board port number the LED is connected to. The port should be capable of generating PWM signal.
B1oqkTnIb.label: PORT

rJIdYs1LB.description: Updates the luminocity of the LED on incoming value change while `ACT` is true.
rJIdYs1LB.label: ACT

@/led.description:
Drives a generic single color dimmable LED. The conversion between luminance and LED power is biased so that change in brightness on range 0…1 is percepted more or less uniformly by a human.

Possible errors:
— Invalid port

BySz0iWtW.description: Acceleration along Y axis. Expressed in ɡ units.
BySz0iWtW.label: Yg

HJzzRiWt-.description: Acceleration along X axis. Expressed in ɡ units.
HJzzRiWt-.label: Xg

S1x-AsWKb.description: Sensitivity. Can be 6 (default), 12, or 24. Defines bounds of measurements expressed in ɡ (standard gravity) units. E.g. max ±12g. The lower the sensitivity the better output precission. Inaccurate values are rounded up to a nearest correct sensitivity level.
S1x-AsWKb.label: SENS

SJFeRsZYW.description: I²C address. 18h by default. Some board configurations use 19h instead.
SJFeRsZYW.label: ADDR

rkPG0s-YZ.description: Acceleration along Z axis. Expressed in ɡ units.
rkPG0s-YZ.label: Zg

rkwA4gweX.description: Triggers initialization of the sensor and sets sensitivity
rkwA4gweX.label: INIT

@/lis331hh-accelerometer.description:
Reads acceleration from an accelerometer based on LIS331HH IC by STMicroelectronics. It is expected the accelerometer is connected to the first hardware I²C bus.

Possible errors:
— Invalid I2C address
— Data too long to fit in transmit buffer
— Received NACK on transmit of address
— Received NACK on transmit of data
— Other error
— No bytes written. Probably due to buffer overflow
— Can't read the value

BySz0iWtW.description: Acceleration along Y axis. Expressed in ɡ units.
BySz0iWtW.label: Yg

HJzzRiWt-.description: Acceleration along X axis. Expressed in ɡ units.
HJzzRiWt-.label: Xg

S1x-AsWKb.description: Sensitivity. Can be 2 (default), 4, 8, or 16. Defines bounds of measurements expressed in ɡ (standard gravity) units. E.g. max ±4g. The lower the sensitivity the better output precission. Inaccurate values are rounded up to a nearest correct sensitivity level.
S1x-AsWKb.label: SENS

SJFeRsZYW.description: I²C address. 18h by default. Some board configurations use 19h instead.
SJFeRsZYW.label: ADDR

SJvJreweQ.description: Triggers initialization of the sensor and sets sensitivity
SJvJreweQ.label: INIT

rkPG0s-YZ.description: Acceleration along Z axis. Expressed in ɡ units.
rkPG0s-YZ.label: Zg

@/lis3dh-accelerometer.description:
Reads acceleration from an accelerometer based on LIS3DH IC by STMicroelectronics. It is expected the accelerometer is connected to the first hardware I²C bus.

Possible errors:
— Invalid I2C address
— Data too long to fit in transmit buffer
— Received NACK on transmit of address
— Received NACK on transmit of data
— Other error
— No bytes written. Probably due to buffer overflow
— Can't read the value

SJlVI0O-7.description: Altitude above the sea level in meters.
SJlVI0O-7.label: ALT

@/lps331-barometer.description:
Reads temprature, pressure, altitude from a barometer based on LPS331 chip by STMicroelectronics.

Possible errors:
— Invalid I2C address
— Data too long to fit in transmit buffer
— Received NACK on transmit of address
— Received NACK on transmit of data
— Other error
— No bytes written. Probably due to buffer overflow
— Can't read the value

BySz0iWtW.description: Acceleration along Y axis. Expressed in ɡ units.
BySz0iWtW.label: Yg

Byq6VeDl7.description: Triggers initialization of the sensor and sets sensitivity
Byq6VeDl7.label: INIT

HJzzRiWt-.description: Acceleration along X axis. Expressed in ɡ units.
HJzzRiWt-.label: Xg

S1x-AsWKb.description: Sensitivity. Can be 2 (default), 4, or 8. Defines bounds of measurements expressed in ɡ (standard gravity) units. E.g. max ±4g. The lower the sensitivity the better output precission. Inaccurate values are rounded up to a nearest correct sensitivity level.
S1x-AsWKb.label: SENS

SJFeRsZYW.description: I²C address. 18h by default. Some board configurations use 19h instead.
SJFeRsZYW.label: ADDR

rkPG0s-YZ.description: Acceleration along Z axis. Expressed in ɡ units.
rkPG0s-YZ.label: Zg

@/lis331dlh-accelerometer.description:
Reads acceleration from an accelerometer based on LIS331DLH IC by STMicroelectronics. It is expected the accelerometer is connected to the first hardware I²C bus.

Possible errors:
— Invalid I2C address
— Data too long to fit in transmit buffer
— Received NACK on transmit of address
— Received NACK on transmit of data
— Other error
— No bytes written. Probably due to buffer overflow
— Can't read the value

H1sM2A12-.description: The last read potentiometer position in range [0.0, 1.0].
H1sM2A12-.label: VAL

Hkry2AJhW.description: A board ADC port the potentiometer is connected to.
Hkry2AJhW.label: PORT

@/pot.description:
Reads values from a generic potentiometer. Basically a thin wrapper around `analog-input` for a simpler learning experience.

Possible errors:
— Invalid port

ByFmEf4US.description: Pulses when a reading completes successfully
ByFmEf4US.label: OK

HJFz4zELS.description: Trigger sensor update, that is starts a new reading
HJFz4zELS.label: UPD

Syp1NfVIS.description: The board port to which the sensor is connected. The built-in pull-up resistor is enabled on read
Syp1NfVIS.label: PORT

r1IbNfVUS.description: The maximal time of signal bounce on a switch in seconds. Changes during this time window are ignored to settle down the contact
r1IbNfVUS.label: Tb

@/mechanical-switch.description: Represents a switch which suffers from bouncing when engaged or disengaged (e.g., reed switch, push-button, mercury switch, bumper switch, rocker switch).

B1jH-YVzB.description: Fires when the data change is acknowledged
B1jH-YVzB.label: ACK

HyAya54Gr.description: Makes the node react to incoming values
HyAya54Gr.label: ACT

SJdzbYEzH.description: Board port number the relay is connected to
SJdzbYEzH.label: PORT

SkgXWK4MB.description: Engages the relay switch when the value is `True`. Make sure to keep switching rate lower than allowed by the relay model (often no more than once per second).
SkgXWK4MB.label: ON

HkpclMN8B.description: Sets PWM duty cycle for the load in the range [0; 1] where 0.0 is full off and 1.0 is full on.
HkpclMN8B.label: VAL

HyraxMELr.description: Acknowledge. Pulses when a change on VAL is reflected to the hardware
HyraxMELr.label: ACK

rk6igfNUr.description: Active. When false, the node does not follow changes of VAL
rk6igfNUr.label: ACT

rkCKlzEUB.description: The board port to which the load signal pin is connected
rkCKlzEUB.label: PORT

@/pwm-load.description: Represents some actuator connected directly to a pin or through a BJT/FET/SSR which supports PWM power adjustment (e.g. a pump, fan, DC motor, or lamp)

BJGhy4lgG.description: CS (chip select) pin the SD card reader is connected to. Also known as SS (slave select).
BJGhy4lgG.label: CS

BJK0yEglf.description: Perform file open, write, flush, close cycle
BJK0yEglf.label: W

@/sd-log.description:
Appends lines of text to a file on SD card.

Possible errors:
— Can't open a file
— Initialization failed or no SD card
— Can't write data to SD card

S1vGmu6Gb.description: Board port number the servo is connected to.
S1vGmu6Gb.label: PORT

r1sfQ_6fb.description: Desired servo angle or value in unit range [0.0, 1.0]. For standard servo 0.0 would be mapped to 0° and 1.0 would be 180°.
r1sfQ_6fb.label: VAL

@/servo.description:
Drives a standard hobby servo.

Possible errors:
— Invalid port

BkVN0JQYW.description: Value for CTRL_REG1 register. Set once on boot.
BkVN0JQYW.label: REG1

HJaCs4jDW.description: Desired sensitivity value. Inaccurate values are rounded up to one of [S0, S1, S2, S3].
HJaCs4jDW.label: SENS

HyTe3Ejv-.description: Z register value adjusted with sensitivity multiplier
HyTe3Ejv-.label: Z

S1_e24ov-.description: Y register value adjusted with sensitivity multiplier
S1_e24ov-.label: Y

Sk-e2ViDb.description: X register value adjusted with sensitivity multiplier
Sk-e2ViDb.label: X

BkgWdYE_-.content: ↑ This reads X Y Z register data and multiplies it by a sensitivity multiplier (sm)

By8nzR4qE.content: Allow reading only after setup is done

HJI6DtEu-.content: ↑ This sends commands to adjust sensitivity (CTRL_REG4)

HJQVOKE_W.content: ↑ This is one-time initialization to go out of sleep mode and start measuring data along all axes (CTRL_REG1)

@/st-imu-generic-sensor.description:
Utility node. Reads raw X/Y/Z data from a STMicroelectronics IMU sensor.

Possible errors:
— Invalid I2C address
— Data too long to fit in transmit buffer
— Received NACK on transmit of address
— Received NACK on transmit of data
— Other error
— No bytes written. Probably due to buffer overflow
— Can't read the value

ByVVj-7Kb.content:
Given 16-bit number, only 12 MSB contain data. So we divide by 16 to shift right by 4 bits.

We ge a value in milli-g. Divide by 1000 to convert to g.

Finally, the divisor is 16000

@/st-imu-normalize-acc.description: Converts raw axis register value of an ST IMU to a value in g units

@/st-imu-normalize-va.description: Converts raw axis register value of an ST IMU to an angular velocity expressed in radians per second

@/st-imu-read-xyz.description:
Possible errors:
— Invalid I2C address
— Data too long to fit in transmit buffer
— Received NACK on transmit of address
— Received NACK on transmit of data
— Other error
— No bytes written. Probably due to buffer overflow
— Can't read the value

B1pDRtEdb.description: Sensitivity value as requested by user.
B1pDRtEdb.label: SEN

r1NqAYVdb.description: Level 2 sensitivity provided by the sensor, e.g. ±4g
r1NqAYVdb.label: S1

r1lUy5N_b.description: Value for CTRL_REG4 to set the sensitivity selected
r1lUy5N_b.label: REG

rk850K4u-.description: Level 3 sensitivity provided by the sensor, e.g. ±8g
rk850K4u-.label: S2

ryP8LnZtZ.description: Level 4 sensitivity provided by the sensor, e.g. ±16g
ryP8LnZtZ.label: S3

rynt0KE_W.description: Level 1 sensitivity provided by the sensor, e.g. ±2g
rynt0KE_W.label: S0

SJ4oMJh0E.content:
S0 was unused before as well,
because getting `IDX` from old `discretize-4` node did not require the first value

@/st-imu-round-sensitivity.description: Rounds up a desired sensitivity of an ST IMU sensor `SEN` to one of [S0, S1, S2, S3]

BJJqaX4Gb.description: Board GPIO port with LCD D4 pin
BJJqaX4Gb.label: D4

HJysTXVMb.description: Board GPIO port with LCD D6 pin
HJysTXVMb.label: D6

S1nqa7NMZ.description: Board GPIO port with LCD D5 pin
S1nqa7NMZ.label: D5

SkBK6Q4fb.description: Board GPIO port with LCD EN pin
SkBK6Q4fb.label: EN

rJlYT7EfW.description: Board GPIO port with LCD RS pin
rJlYT7EfW.label: RS

rkbjp7Ezb.description: Board GPIO port with LCD D7 pin
rkbjp7Ezb.label: D7

@/text-lcd-16x2.description:
Drives a text LCD screen with HD44780 chip.

Possible errors:
— Invalid port

H1s0WI6MZ.description: Board ADC port with the sensor
H1s0WI6MZ.label: PORT

@/thermometer-tmp36.description:
Drives a digital thermometer based on TMP36 IC.

Possible errors:
— Invalid port

rJlYT7EfW.description: I²C address of the expander chip.
rJlYT7EfW.label: ADDR

@/text-lcd-16x2-i2c.description:
Drives a text LCD screen with a PCF8574 or PCA8574 I²C expander module. Usually have a value in range 0x20-0x27 or 0x38-0x3F. Consult LCD/expander documentation to know the exact value.

Possible errors:
— Invalid I2C address

description: Hardware drivers for popular and simple peripherals
name: common-hardware
